-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | LOLSPEAK translator
--   
@package acme-lolcat
@version 0.1.1


-- | <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; (OH HAI I CAN HAZ ЙO? THXBYE &lt;*&gt; putStrLn) "LOL" == ()
--   LOL
--   True
--   </pre>
module Acme.LOLCAT.IO
data OH a b c d e
OH :: a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> OH a b c d e
data HAI a b c d e
HAI :: a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> HAI a b c d e
data I
I :: I
data CAN
CAN :: CAN
data HAZ
HAZ :: HAZ
data IO
IO :: IO
data ÏO
ÏO :: ÏO
data ЙО
ЙО :: ЙО
data ЙO
ЙO :: ЙO
data YO
YO :: YO
(?) :: Monad m => t -> t1 -> m (IO a -> a)
data THXBYE
THXBYE :: THXBYE


-- | LOLCAT translator.
--   
--   Roughly based on <a>Acme::LOLCAT</a> for Perl.
module Acme.LOLCAT

-- | <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; translate "Catamorphisms are generalizations of the concept of a fold in functional programming."
--   "CAT-A-MURRFISMS AR GENERALIZASHUNS OV TEH CONCEPT OV FOLD IN FUNCSHUNAL PROGRAMMNG. THX."
--   </pre>
translate :: KindaText s => s -> s

-- | Text/String-like things
class KindaText a
instance Eq ParserState
instance IsString (Parser String)
instance KindaText String
instance KindaText Text
